util.misc
Class Fonts

java.lang.Object
  util.misc.Fonts

public abstract class Fonts
extends java.lang.Object

Obtains information about fonts that is more accurate then the built-in metrics.

Field Detail

isBrokenMacOS

public static boolean isBrokenMacOS
Mac OS X 10.3.9, at least in Java version 1.4.2_12, throws nasty exceptions when trying to render Unicode characters in headless mode (only if they don't exist in the current font, I think, but still). We replace characters with question marks in that case; running on 10.3 is therefore not supported.

Fonts

public Fonts()

getRightExtent

public static int getRightExtent(java.awt.Font f,
                                 char c)
Returns the actual right extent of a character, in pixels from its origin point (i.e. does not include the left overlap).

Parameters:
f - Font
c - Character
Returns:
Right extent in pixels

getItalicRightOverlap

public static int getItalicRightOverlap(java.awt.Font f,
                                        char cEdge)
Obtain the number of pixels that a given character overlaps to the right of its claimed advance width, when the italic slope is taken into account. (In other words, it is expected that the top part of an I will overlap by a bit, so we don't count that here whereas getRightOverlap does.)

Parameters:
f - Font
cEdge - Character being considered
Returns:
Number of pixels (min 0)

drawCharacterTest

public static int drawCharacterTest(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                                    java.awt.Font f,
                                    char c,
                                    int iX,
                                    int iY)
Display character metrics (for testing).

Parameters:
g2 - Graphics context
f - Font
c - Character
iX - X co-ordinate to start drawing
iY - Y co-ordinate
Returns:
Number of X pixels used

getAscent

public static int getAscent(java.awt.Font f,
                            char c)
Obtains the actual ascent of a given character. Ascent is defined as pixels above the baseline.

Parameters:
f - Font
c - Character
Returns:
Ascent in pixels

getDescent

public static int getDescent(java.awt.Font f,
                             char c)
Obtains the actual descent of a given character. Ascent is defined as pixels below and including the baseline.

Parameters:
f - Font
c - Character
Returns:
Descent in pixels

getMaxAscent

public static int getMaxAscent(java.awt.Font f,
                               java.lang.String sText)
Returns ascent for a piece of text.

Parameters:
f - Font
sText - Text to examine
Returns:
Ascent for that text (low if it's just lower-case, for instance)

getMaxDescent

public static int getMaxDescent(java.awt.Font f,
                                java.lang.String sText)
Returns descent for a piece of text.

Parameters:
f - Font
sText - Text to examine
Returns:
Descent for that text (could be zero if no descenders, for instance)

getMaxNormalAscent

public static int getMaxNormalAscent(java.awt.Font f)
Parameters:
f - Font to consider
Returns:
Maximum ascent for alphanumeric characters in font (does NOT include accents)

getMaxNormalDescent

public static int getMaxNormalDescent(java.awt.Font f)
Parameters:
f - Font to consider
Returns:
Maximum descent for alphanumeric characters in font (does NOT include accents)
